data.title: Soccer scores
data.statement:
Find the leading team in a list of soccer teams.
There a three deciding criteria:
First: The total points [[p]].
Second: The difference between goals scored by this team [[x]] and goals scored by opponents[[y]].
Third: If based on first and second criteria teams are equal the team with more goals [[x]] is leading.

testCases.title: Crazy League
testCases.testIn:
9
XYZ 0 0 0
ChuckNorris 1000 1001 1
Hulk 999 1000 1000
_Royale 1000 1002 2
noob 3 1 0
bob 1 2 3
BlackBird 70 4000 7
CocBOT 404 444 1
Name_Of_Person_Who_Approve_this 1000 1003 3

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
9
XXX 888 888 888
ChuckNorris 1000 1002 2
Hulk 1000 1000 1
_Royale 1000 1001 1
noob 0 9 6
bob 3 2 1
BlackBird 70 4000 7
CocBOT 404 444 1
Name_Of_Person_Who_Approve_this 0 0 0

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read s:word(100) p:int x:int y:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Number of teams [[n]]
<<Following [[n]] Lines:>> Name of team [[s]]; total points [[p]]; goals scored by this team [[x]];  goals scored by opponents[[y]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Find the leading team in a list of soccer teams.
There a three deciding criteria:
First: The total points p.
Second: The difference between goals scored by this team x and goals scored by opponentsy.
Third: If based on first and second criteria teams are equal the team with more goals x is leading.
Input
Line 1: Number of teams n
Following n Lines: Name of team s; total points p; goals scored by this team x; goals scored by opponentsy
Output
One Line: Name of leading team
Constraints
n < 10
s.Length < 100
Example
Input
3
TeamOne 3 1 2
TeamTwo 5 6 2
TeamThree 6 9 7
Output
TeamThree
